titles.title: A joint resolution approving the location of the Black Revolutionary War Patriots Memorial.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston without amendment and with a preamble. With written report No. 100-288.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 542.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House by House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. Report No: 100-515.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.

committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 11/10/1987--Introduced. Approves the location of a commemorative work in the District of Columbia to honor the slaves and free black persons who served as soldiers and sailors, or provided civilian assistance during the American Revolution and to honor the black men, women, and children who ran away from slavery, or filed petitions with courts and legislatures seeking their freedom.
